results.title: Our Film Critics Discuss the Future of Movies
results.abstract: Taking a look at the new season in the new abnormal, while remembering the lessons of cinema history. Are we on the cusp of a new era or will this too pass?
results.byline: By Manohla Dargis and A.O. Scott

results.title: Venice: Women’s Stories
results.abstract: Films by or about women stood out at this year’s Venice International Film Festival, though they represented only a fraction of the titles showcased.

multimedia.caption: Milena Smit, left, and Penélope Cruz in “Parallel Mothers.”
Milena Smit, left, and Penélope Cruz in “Parallel Mothers.”

results.title: When Wes Anderson Comes to Town, Buildings Get Symmetrical
results.abstract: For “The French Dispatch,” the filmmakers set up shop in a real French city to create the setting for the movie’s fictional one.

multimedia.caption: The French Dispatch building in Wes Anderson’s film. The shot uses a combination of real exteriors in Angoulême, a town in southwest France, and miniatures to achieve its look.

results.title: There’s Always Been More to Kirsten Dunst
results.abstract: A former child star and ingénue, she has come into her own as a chronicler of despair. Will “The Power of the Dog” cap her career reinvention?

multimedia.caption: Of her recent performances, Kirsten Dunst explained, “I’m not afraid to share my pain.”

results.title: For a Fractured Israel, a Film Offers Ominous Lessons From Ancient Past
results.abstract: An animated epic depicting a Jewish civil war and the destruction of the Second Temple 2,000 years ago is being seen as a warning in a deeply divided country.

results.title: Nino Castelnuovo, ‘The Umbrellas of Cherbourg’ Star, Dies at 84
results.abstract: Mr. Castelnuovo, who brought an incandescent charm to the screen, became famous during a golden age of Italian cinema. But his breakthrough role was in a French film.

multimedia.caption: Nino Castelnuovo secured his place in the international film canon for his performance opposite Catherine Deneuve in Jacques Demy’s 1964 musical, “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg.”
Nino Castelnuovo secured his place in the international film canon for his performance opposite Catherine Deneuve in Jacques Demy’s 1964 musical, “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg.”

results.title: ‘Fauci’ Review: The First Pandemic That Shaped the Good Doc
results.abstract: This documentary underscores the hard-fought lessons the immunologist learned during the AIDS pandemic. Many shape his resolve now.
org_facet: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

results.title: Mark Duplass Can’t Get Enough of ‘Rocky II’
results.abstract: The filmmaker and star of “Language Lessons” discusses his teenage education in indie cinema and the screenwriting lessons in “Waiting For Godot.”

results.title: Art Metrano, Actor and Comic Once Felled by an Accident, Dies at 84
results.abstract: He had built a career in stand-up comedy and in film and TV, but a fall from a ladder left him with a personal struggle.

multimedia.caption: The actor Art Metrano in the 1980s. His career was interrupted by an accident in 1989. “When you’re lying paralyzed in a hospital bed,” he said during a subsequent stage show, “your past becomes your constant companion because your future is a question mark.”

The actor Art Metrano in the 1980s. His career was interrupted by an accident in 1989. “When you’re lying paralyzed in a hospital bed,” he said during a subsequent stage show, “your past becomes your constant companion because your future is a question mark.”

results.title: Kaycee Moore, Actress in Black Directors’ Seminal Films, Dies at 77
results.abstract: She explored her characters’ inner lives in movies like “Killer of Sheep” and “Bless Their Little Hearts,” independent works that grew out of the L.A. Rebellion movement.

multimedia.caption: Kaycee Moore in the film “Killer of Sheep,” in which she played the wife of a slaughterhouse worker as she struggles to raise a family in the Watts section of Los Angeles. She made only a handful of movies, but they had an outsize impact on American cinema.

Kaycee Moore in the film “Killer of Sheep,” in which she played the wife of a slaughterhouse worker as she struggles to raise a family in the Watts section of Los Angeles. She made only a handful of movies, but they had an outsize impact on American cinema.

results.title: ‘Beetlejuice’ Will Return to Broadway in April
results.abstract: It was pushed out of the Winter Garden to make way for “The Music Man.” Now this fan-favorite musical is getting a second life at the Marriott Marquis.

results.title: ‘25th Hour’: The Best 9/11 Movie Was Always About New York
results.abstract: While other directors edited out the twin towers from movies at the time, Spike Lee worked the tragedy into a story originally about other things.

results.title: ‘Muhammad Ali’ Explores the Many Layers of ‘the Greatest’
results.abstract: A new four-part documentary series by Ken Burns paints a sweeping portrait of a man whose life intersected with many of modern America’s most profound changes.

multimedia.caption: Like many aspects of Muhammad Ali’s life, this photo of him defeating Sonny Liston in 1965 transcended boxing. A new documentary assesses Ali’s impact inside the ring and out.

results.title: Impersonation? Yes. But With the Right Star, Something Richer.
results.abstract: In new musicals about Princess Diana, Cary Grant and Michael Jackson actors get a chance to embody icons while spotlighting their individual talents.

results.title: Michael Constantine, Father in ‘My Big Fat Greek Wedding,’ Dies at 94
results.abstract: He won an Emmy for his role on the TV series “Room 222” and played many other characters over the years before becoming known as the hit film’s patriarch.

multimedia.caption: Michael Constantine as Gus Portokalos, the combustible, tradition-bound father of the bride, in the hit 2002 movie “My Big Fat Greek Wedding.”

results.title: Venice Film Festival: Tim Blake Nelson Gets the Lead. Someone Send Him a Tux.
results.abstract: The veteran character may have been featured in Coen brothers movies, but for a small western, he’s the one who is working hard to get it seen.
